Project.name: PureMVC MultiCore for Haxe 2
Project.Description: PureMVC is a lightweight framework for creating applications based upon the classic Model-View-Controller design meta-pattern. This is the specific implementation of the MultiCore version for the Haxe platform.
Project.ReleaseNotes: Summary of Changes in 1.2 * Libraries now include version number. - CLH Summary of Changes in 1.1 * Haxe 2.0 compatibility. This version is no longer compatible with older versions of Haxe. Summary of Features in Version 1.0 * First official release on PureMVC.org for haXe. . * Compatible with AS3 MultiCore reference version 1.0.5
Project.Installation: Prerequisites * You must have Haxe 2 installed. - http://haxe.org Installing the Project Source Code * From the archive * Download the latest source code archive. * Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. For instance: c:\development\ * You will see a PureMVC_Haxe_MultiCore_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. For instance: c:\development\PureMVC_Haxe_MultiCore_X_Y * From the Repository * Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository.

Project.name: PureMVC Haxe 2 MultiCore Unit Tests
Project.ReleaseNotes: Features in Version 1.0 * Unit tests for 1.2 version of MultiCore framework. This release include tests for all supported platforms.
Project.Installation: Prerequisites * You must have you must have Haxe installed. * You must have the latest release of PureMVC Framework for haXe installed. * You may optionally have NekoVM installed. Compiling the Unit Tests * Edit the build_tests.hxml file: * Find the lines with '# -cp path to PureMVC' * Replace 'path to PureMVC' with the absolute location of the PureMVC source folder on your system * Uncomment the line (remove the leading #) * Save the file. * Open terminal and change the directory path to the PureMVC folder. * Next type 'haxe build_test.hxml' * On Windows systems you can simply double-click on the 'build_test.hxml' file. Running Unit Tests You can run unit tests for all supported platforms: * Flash 6, 7, 8, 9: * Open the 'indexFl.html' file located in 'test_deploy' * JavaScript: * Open the 'indexJs.html' file located in 'test_deploy' (there seems to be a bug on Safari and test messages are not traced) * Neko: * Open terminal and change the direcotry path to the 'test_deploy' folder. * Next type 'neko testRunner.n'
